Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.client

Interface HalApiClient

@ProviderType public interface HalApiClient
A type-safe HAL client that will create a dynamic proxy implementation for a given URI and HalApiInterface. It can be used instead of Rhyme.getRemoteResource(String, Class) if you only want to consume HAL resources (but not render them).

Whenever you call a method on the proxy returned by getRemoteResource(String, Class) that is annotated with a relevant annotation (e.g Related or ResourceState), an HTTP request to the upstream resource will be triggered, and additional client proxies for the related resources will be created based on the links in the response. This allows you to navigate through the resources simply by calling the methods defined in your HAL API interfaces. The actual loading of the upstream resources is delegated to a HalResourceLoader instance.

The HalApiClient instance will be caching the proxy objects (based on the URL of the corresponding resources), and the return value of any method called on the proxy objects. This allows you to call the same methods multiple times without the overhead of repeated JSON parsing or duplicate HTTP requests. On the other hand you shouldn't use the same HalApiClient instance for too long (e.g. for multiple incoming requests to your server), since no invalidation of those caches will take place as long as your are using the same HalApiClient instance.

If a more persistent caching of the HAL responses is required, then this is implemented in the HalResourceLoader instead.

Further customization of the HalApiClient instance can be done using the HalApiClientBuilder.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getRemoteResource

      <T> T getRemoteResource(String uri, Class<T> halApiInterface)
      Create a dynamic client proxy to load and navigate through HAL+JSON resources
      Type Parameters:
      T - the HAL API interface type
      Parameters:
      uri - the absolute URI of the resource to load (usually the entry point of the HAL API)
      halApiInterface - the HAL API interface class of a service's entry point resource
      Returns:
      a proxy implementation of the specified entry point interface

    • create

      static HalApiClient create()
      Create a stand-alone HalApiClient (i.e. not to be used in the lifecycle of a Rhyme instance) that is using a default, blocking HTTP client. If you need more control over how your HTTP requests are executed and cached, use create(HalResourceLoader) instead.
      Returns:
      an instance of HalApiClient that uses a default HTTP client implementation

    • create

      static HalApiClient create(HalResourceLoader resourceLoader)
      Create a stand-alone HalApiClient (i.e. not to be used in the lifecycle of a Rhyme instance) that executes the HTTP request with the given HalResourceLoader. That loader can be configured and build using a HalResourceLoaderBuilder.
      Parameters:
      resourceLoader - implements the actual loading (and caching) of JSON/HAL resources via any HTTP client library
      Returns:
      an instance of HalApiClient that should be re-used for all upstream requests required by the current incoming request
      See Also:
      • HalResourceLoader
      • HalResourceLoaderBuilder

    • create

      @Deprecated static HalApiClient create(HalResourceLoader resourceLoader, RequestMetricsCollector metrics)
      Deprecated.
      use HalApiClientBuilder instead
      Parameters:
      resourceLoader - implements the actual loading (and caching) of JSON/HAL resources via any HTTP client library
      metrics - an instance of RequestMetricsCollector to collect performance relevant data for the current incoming request
      Returns:
      an instance of HalApiClient that should be re-used for all upstream requests required by the current incoming request

    • create

      @Deprecated static HalApiClient create(HalResourceLoader resourceLoader, RequestMetricsCollector metrics, HalApiAnnotationSupport annotationSupport, HalApiReturnTypeSupport returnTypeSupport)
      Deprecated.
      use HalApiClientBuilder instead
      An advanced overload of create(HalResourceLoader, RequestMetricsCollector) that allows the client to be used with interfaces using non-standard annotations or return types.
      Parameters:
      resourceLoader - implements the actual loading (and caching) of JSON/HAL resources via any HTTP client library
      metrics - an instance of RequestMetricsCollector to collect performance relevant data for the current incoming request
      annotationSupport - an (optional) strategy to identify HAL API interfaces and methods that use different annotations
      returnTypeSupport - an (optional) strategy to support additional return types in your HAL API interface methods
      Returns:
      an instance of HalApiClient that should be re-used for all upstream requests required by the current incoming request
